sen.j: 相性（あいしょう）とは、二人ないし複数の人間が各々持つ性質や性格が合うかどうかのことである。
sen.e: Aisho refers to the compatibility of qualities and characters between two or more people.
Aisho refers to the compatibility of qualities and characters between two or more people.
Aisho refers to the compatibility of qualities and characters between two or more people.

sen.j: 転じて、機械部品などの物に対しても、組み合わせが良い・悪いという場合に相性という言い方をする場合がある。
sen.e: By further extension, when speaking of machine parts, 'aisho' is sometimes used to say the combination of the parts is good or bad.
By further extension, when speaking of machine parts, 'aisho' is sometimes used to say if the combination of the parts is good or bad.
By further extension, when speaking of machine parts, 'aisho' is sometimes used to say if the combination of the parts is good or bad.

sen.j: 語源
sen.e: The origin of the word
The origin of the word
The origin of the word

sen.j: 相性の、元々の意味は陰陽五行思想の一端で、全ての事物が持つ属性が、相互に良い意味で影響しあってより強まるか、逆に相互の良い部分を相殺しあって悪い状態を招くかといったものである。
sen.e: Aisho was originally derived from the part of the philosophy of Onmyo gogyo (Yin-Yang Wu-Xin), which explained that when the attributes of all things influence each other in a good way, they become stronger; when they balance out the good qualities in each other, on the other hand, this invites bad situations.

Aisho was originally derived from the part of the philosophy of Onmyo gogyo (Yin-Yang Wu-Xin), which explained that when the attributes of all things influence each other in a good way, they become stronger; when they balance out the good qualities in each other, on the other hand, this invites bad situations.

Aisho was originally derived from the part of the philosophy of Onmyo gogyo (Yin-Yang Wu-Xin), which explained that when the attributes of all things influence each other in a good way, they become stronger; when they balance out the good qualities in each other, on the other hand, this invites bad situations.

sen.j: 端的にいうなら、火と木が合わさると、火は勢いを増しより多くの熱を発生させるが、逆に火と水とでは水は炎で蒸発してしまうほか、火もその勢いを削がれる...といったようなものである。
sen.e: To put it shortly, the idea is that when fire and wood are combined, the fire gathers strength and produces a high level of heat, but when fire and water are combined, not only the water evaporates, the fire loses its momentum.

To put it shortly, the idea is that when fire and wood are combined, the fire gathers strength and produces a high level of heat, but when fire and water are combined, not only the water evaporates, the fire loses its momentum.

To put it shortly, the idea is that when fire and wood are combined, the fire gathers strength and produces a high level of heat, but when fire and water are combined, not only the water evaporates, the fire loses its momentum.

sen.j: 実際はより複雑であるが、こういった思想の類型では四大元素など、相互に影響しあって何らかの結果を招くという意味で、この関係性が「相性」という言葉で表された。
sen.e: The actual idea is much more complicated; nonetheless, the relationship, in which things, such as four elements, influence each other and this then leads to a consequence, was expressed with a term 'aisho'.

The actual idea is much more complicated; nonetheless, the relationship, in which things, such as four elements, influence each other and this then leads to a consequence, was expressed with a term 'aisho.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: The actual idea is much more complicated; nonetheless, the relationship, in which things, such as four elements, influence each other and this then leads to a consequence, was expressed with a term 'aisho.'

sen.j: 後に時代が下ると、これは人同士の関係性においても利用された。
sen.e: At a later stage in history, it was used to refer to the relationships between people.
sen.cmt: 一原文一例文例外対処
sen.e: At a later stage in history, it was used to refer to the relationships between people.
At a later stage in history, it was used to refer to the relationships between people.

sen.j: 特に陰陽では相反する要素と考える男女の関係性などを含む様々な側面でも利用されたことは想像に難くない。
sen.e: Especially in the philosophy of Onmyo, it is not hard to imagine that term was applied to various aspects of things including the relationship between men and women, which are considered to be of opposite elements.
sen.cmt: 一原文一例文例外対処
sen.e: Especially in the philosophy of Onmyo, it is not hard to imagine that term was applied to various aspects of things including the relationship between men and women, which are considered to be of opposite elements.

Especially in the philosophy of Onmyo, it is not hard to imagine that term was applied to various aspects of things including the relationship between men and women, which are considered to be of opposite elements.

sen.j: 人間関係における相性
sen.e: Aisho in terms of the human relationships
Aisho in terms of the human relationships
Aisho in terms of the human relationships

sen.j: ただ更に時代を下った近代では、陰陽五行思想は一般には余り気に掛けられず、専ら各々の人などが持つ要素・属性などの相互関係で、望ましい方向に発展することを「相性が良い」といい、どうも芳しくない結果に陥りがちな関係は「相性が悪い」と表現する。
sen.e: In the modern times, the philosophy of Onmyo gogyo is not much cared for in general; in terms of the compatibility of elements and attributes, when it seems that the combination of something may develop to a desired direction, it is said to have a 'good aisho,' and when the combination may produce a undesirable result, it is said to have a 'bad aisho'.

In the modern times, the philosophy of Onmyo gogyo is not much cared for in general; simply, when the mutual relationship between the elements or attributes of people develops to a desired direction, it is said to have a 'good aisho,' and when the combination may produces an undesirable result, it is said to have a 'bad aisho.'
sen.cmt: 自然な訳になるように修正しました。文法を修正しました。ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In the modern times, the philosophy of Onmyo gogyo is not much cared for in general; simply, when the mutual relationship between the elements or attributes of people develops to a desired direction, it is said to have a 'good aisho,' and when the combination may produces an undesirable result, it is said to have a 'bad aisho.'

sen.j: この場合は、恋人関係から上司と部下など組織の役職を含む関係や同僚ないし仲間同士など、様々な人間関係でこの「相性」が気にされる。
sen.e: In such a case, 'aisho' is considered in terms of various human relationships such as the relationship between lovers and the relationships concerning the organizational roles including the relation between the boss and the subordinates and between co-workers, as well as the relationship between friends.

In such a case, 'aisho' is placed importance in terms of various human relationships such as the relationship between lovers and the relationships concerning the organizational roles including those between the boss and the subordinates and between co-workers, as well as the relationship between friends.
sen.cmt: 自然な訳になるように修正しました。
sen.e: In such a case, 'aisho' is placed importance in terms of various human relationships such as the relationship between lovers and the relationships concerning the organizational roles including those between the boss and the subordinates and between co-workers, as well as the relationship between friends.

sen.j: しかし個人の持つ要素が多岐に渡り、その組み合わせによっても様々な相互作用が発生しうる。
sen.e: However the characteristics of individuals are varied, and depending on the combination, different mutual effects are produced.
However, the characteristics of individuals are varied, and depending on the combination, different mutual effects are produced.
However, the characteristics of individuals are varied, and depending on the combination, different mutual effects are produced.

sen.j: ともすれば似たようなケースでもシチュエーションが違えば結果も大きく変化するなど、事前に判るような性質のものでは無い。
sen.e: Even in similar cases, the result can be greatly different depending on the situation; this is not something which can be predicted beforehand.
Even in similar cases, the result can be greatly different depending on the situation; this is not something which can be predicted beforehand.
Even in similar cases, the result can be greatly different depending on the situation; this is not something which can be predicted beforehand.

sen.j: 大抵の場合において「相性が良い/悪い」という場合は、予め関係しあった結果を指す傾向にある。
sen.e: In most cases, when someone is said to have a 'good/bad aisho' with another person, it expresses the result which had been influenced by the given relationship.
sen.cmt: 日本語原文の意味が不明瞭です。
sen.e: In most cases, when someone is said to have a 'good/bad aisho' with another person, it expresses the result of an already established relationship.
sen.cmt: 「既に関係を構築した結果」という意味だと思います。
sen.e: In most cases, when someone is said to have a 'good/bad aisho' with another person, it expresses the result of an already established relationship.

sen.j: 例えば、恋人として付き合った結果としてお互いの長所も短所も好ましい性質と感じて結婚に至ったり、どうも所定の上司の前で緊張してしまって良い結果が出せず叱られてばかりだとか、所定の部下に対してだけ態度に不満があって強く注意してしまいがちだとか、あるいはあの同僚とは一緒に話していても楽しくないが、別の同僚とは話が弾む...などである。
sen.e: Such cases include: when, as a result of getting to know each other as lovers, two people consider themselves compatible by taking into account both the good and bad qualities in each other and decide to get married; when one always gets nervous in front of a certain boss, and because of it, cannot bring a good result and gets scolded all the time; when one cannot help reprimanding a certain subordinate because of his/her attitude; or when one always has great conversations with a certain co-worker, but not with another.

For example, as a result of getting to know each other as lovers, two people consider themselves compatible by taking into account both the good and bad qualities in each other and decide to get married; or one always gets nervous in front of a certain boss, and because of it, cannot bring a good result and gets scolded all the time; or one cannot help reprimanding a certain subordinate because of his/her attitude; or one always has great conversations with a certain co-worker, but not with another.
sen.cmt: 自然な訳になるように修正しました。
sen.e: For example, as a result of getting to know each other as lovers, two people consider themselves compatible by taking into account both the good and bad qualities in each other and decide to get married; or one always gets nervous in front of a certain boss, and because of it, cannot bring a good result and gets scolded all the time; or one cannot help reprimanding a certain subordinate because of his/her attitude; or one always has great conversations with a certain co-worker, but not with another.

sen.j: こういった相性では、しばしばあることだが、理知的には説明できないながらも明らかに所定人物同士の関係性が多とは決定的に異なることもある。
sen.e: In such cases of aisho, which happens often, the nature of the relationship between the given people is fundamentally different from that of others even if this cannot be explained rationally.
sen.cmt: 「多とは決定的に異なる」は「他とは決定的に異なる」の誤りかと思われます。
sen.e: In this type of aisho, the nature of the relationship between the given people is often fundamentally different from that of others even if this cannot be explained rationally.
sen.cmt: 自然な訳になるように修正しました。
sen.e: In this type of aisho, the nature of the relationship between the given people is often fundamentally different from that of others even if this cannot be explained rationally.

sen.j: いわゆる「一目ぼれ」（訳も判らず一見で気に入ってしまうこと）や「癪に障る」（苛立たしいと感じる・怒りのうち抑圧 (心理学)され継続的なもの）など、当事者には説明しがたい感情に支配された結果、相性が良い/悪いとみなされる場合もある。
sen.e: The so-called 'love at first sight' (when one is attracted to someone without even knowing him/her) or 'getting under one's skin' (of emotions in regard to frustration and anger, one that is suppressed (psychology) and continual) are the situations which are controlled by emotions inexplicable to the one experiencing it, and as a result of which, they sometimes causes one to consider that he/she has a good/bad aisho with the given person.

The so-called 'love at first sight' (when one is attracted to someone without even knowing him/her) or 'getting under one's skin' (the emotion of frustration and anger that is suppressed (psychology) and continual) are the situations which are controlled by emotions inexplicable to the one experiencing it, and as a result of which causes one to feel that he/she has a good/bad aisho with the given person.
sen.cmt: 自然な訳になるように修正しました。
sen.e: The so-called 'love at first sight' (when one is attracted to someone without even knowing him/her) or 'getting under one's skin' (the emotion of frustration and anger that is suppressed (psychology) and continual) are the situations which are controlled by emotions inexplicable to the one experiencing it, and as a result of which causes one to feel that he/she has a good/bad aisho with the given person.

sen.j: 占いと相性
sen.e: Fortune-telling and aisho
Fortune-telling and aisho
Fortune-telling and aisho

sen.j: 往々にして「付き合ってみないことには判らない」という側面のある相性だ。
sen.e: Generally speaking, aisho has an aspect which 'cannot be discovered unless one actually has a certain degree of closeness to the person.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一例文例外対処
sen.e: Generally speaking, aisho has an aspect which 'cannot be discovered unless one actually has a certain degree of closeness to the person.'
Generally speaking, aisho has an aspect which 'cannot be discovered unless one actually has a certain degree of closeness to the person.'

sen.j: しかしこれを予め知りたいという欲求も、人間がその関係性のなかでしか存在できない（社会的動物）という面もあるために無理の無いところで、しばしばこういった相性を知ろうという考えも存在する。
sen.e: However, it cannot be denied that, as social animals that cannot exist outside the social relationships, humans have desire to know it beforehand; as such, often there is a tendency in us which tries to know the compatibility with others in advance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一例文例外対処
sen.e: However, it cannot be denied that, as social animals that cannot exist outside the social relationships, humans have desire to know it beforehand; as such, often there is a tendency in us which tries to know the compatibility with others in advance.

However, it cannot be denied that, as social animals that cannot exist outside the social relationships, humans have desire to know it beforehand; as such, often there is a tendency in us which tries to know the compatibility with others in advance.

sen.j: いわゆる性格判断などはそういった側面もあるが、更に広く通俗的な分野では、特定の誰かとの相性を知ろうという占いも盛んである。
sen.e: The so-called character diagnosis also has such an aspect, and the fortune-telling which predicts the compatibility with a certain person is popular in a common and colloquial sphere.
The so-called character diagnosis also has such an aspect, and the fortune-telling which predicts the compatibility with a certain person is more popular and common sphere.
sen.cmt: この場合の「通俗的」は「話し言葉の」というよりは一般的にという意味ですので「colloquial」を削除しました。
sen.e: The so-called character diagnosis also has such an aspect, and the fortune-telling which predicts the compatibility with a certain person is more popular and common sphere.

sen.j: 占いは必ずしも理知的ではない論理に基づいた、言い換えればあやふやなものではあるが、娯楽としての要素もあり、大衆に親しまれている。
sen.e: The fortune-telling is based on a theory which is not necessarily logical, which is to say unreliable; however, it has an aspect as an entertainment and it is popular among people.
The fortune-telling is based on a theory which is not necessarily logical, which is to say unreliable; however, it has an aspect as an entertainment and it is popular among people.
The fortune-telling is based on a theory which is not necessarily logical, which is to say unreliable; however, it has an aspect as an entertainment and it is popular among people.

sen.j: 姓名判断や血液型性格分類（ないし血液型占い）、占星術は言うに及ばずラブテスターのような玩具に至るまで枚挙に暇が無く、こういった行為や関連する物品は多い。
sen.e: Not to mention the character diagnosis, character grouping by blood types (or fortune-telling by blood types) and horoscope, there is even toys such as a 'love-tester' and so on; there are many activities and commercial products relating to predicting of aisho.

Not to mention the character diagnosis, character grouping by blood types (or fortune-telling by blood types) and horoscope, there is even toys such as a 'love-tester'; there are many activities and commercial products related to predicting aisho.
sen.cmt: 自然な訳になるように修正しました。
sen.e: Not to mention the character diagnosis, character grouping by blood types (or fortune-telling by blood types) and horoscope, there is even toys such as a 'love-tester'; there are many activities and commercial products related to predicting aisho.

sen.j: また呪術のようなものの中にも、こういった相性に関係するものは多々見出せる。
sen.e: An activity like magic also often deals with the idea of aisho.
An activity like magic also often deals with the idea of aisho.
An activity like magic also often deals with the idea of aisho.

tit.j: パソコン部品の相性について

sen.j: 動作検証が済んでいないパーツの組み合わせにより、パーソナルコンピュータ (PC) の動作が不安定になったり、PCが起動しなくなること。
sen.e: It refers to a phenomenon in which, because of the combination of parts which have not gone through the operation verification, the operation of a personal computer (PC) becomes unstable or the PC cannot be activated.

It refers to a phenomenon in which, because of the combination of parts which have not gone through the operation verification, the operation of a personal computer (PC) becomes unstable or the PC cannot be activated.

It refers to a phenomenon in which, because of the combination of parts which have not gone through the operation verification, the operation of a personal computer (PC) becomes unstable or the PC cannot be activated.

sen.j: 電源ON後のセルフテスト中に止まる。
sen.e: The PC stops during the self-test after the power is switched on.
The PC stops during the self-test after the power is switched on.
The PC stops during the self-test after the power is switched on.

sen.j: が初期化される時に止まる、または再起動する。
sen.e: It either stops or restart when the PCI is initialized.
sen.cmt: 文頭から「PCI」が抜けているようです。
sen.e: It either stops or restart when the PCI is initialized.
It either stops or restart when the PCI is initialized.

sen.j: 起動するが、特定の操作をするとフリーズする。
sen.e: Although it can be activated, it freezes when a certain procedure is operated.
Although it can be activated, it freezes when a certain procedure is operated.
Although it can be activated, it freezes when a certain procedure is operated.

sen.j: （止まっているように見える）
sen.e: (it looks as if it is stopped)
(It looks as if it stopped.)
(It looks as if it stopped.)

sen.j: 起動するが、特定の操作をすると、再起動する。
sen.e: Although it can be activated, it restarts when a certain procedure is operated.
Although it can be activated, it restarts when a certain procedure is operated.
Although it can be activated, it restarts when a certain procedure is operated.

sen.j: などが主な現象で、原因としては、
sen.e: The above mentioned are the observed phenomena, and their causes can be:

sen.j: 各々のパーツに供給されるべき電力の不足。
sen.e: The lack of power which should be supplied to each part;
The lack of power which should be supplied to each part.
The lack of power which should be supplied to each part.

sen.j: 割り込み要求(割り込み)の競合
sen.e: competing interruption requests;
Competing interruption requests.
Competing interruption requests.

sen.j: メモリアドレス(IO) の競合
sen.e: competing memory addresses (IO);
Competing memory addresses (IO).
Competing memory addresses (IO).

sen.j: 規格を逸脱して作られたデバイスドライバ
sen.e: nonstandard device drivers.
Nonstandard device drivers.
Nonstandard device drivers.

sen.j: などがあり、すでに動作しているパーツやドライバが原因の可能性も考えられ、この状態に陥ると、解決を目指すよりも、諦めて構成を変更したほうが良い場合が多い。
sen.e: The above mentioned are the possible causes; it is also possible that some operating parts and drivers are the cause and when the computer goes into such a state, it is often better to change the configuration rather than trying to solve the problem.

And, it is also possible that some operating parts and drivers are the cause and when the computer falls into such a state, it is often better to change the configuration rather than trying to solve the problem.
sen.cmt: 最初の文章は上記文章と重複していますので削除しました。単語を修正しました。
sen.e: And, it is also possible that some operating parts and drivers are the cause and when the computer falls into such a state, it is often better to change the configuration rather than trying to solve the problem.

sen.j: 基本的に共通仕様上の読み違いによって、特性や基本構造に差異があるために起こる現象だ。
sen.e: This is a phenomenon which happens basically because of differences of features and basic structures as a result of misreading of common specifications.
sen.cmt: 一原文一例文例外対処
sen.e: This is a phenomenon which happens basically because of differences in features and basic structures as a result of misreading of common specifications.
This is a phenomenon which happens basically because of differences in features and basic structures as a result of misreading of common specifications.

sen.j: しかしユーザーにして見れば「何だか判らない不都合（競合）」であり、問題の判別は勿論、異常個所の修正は困難を極める。
sen.e: However, this is an 'incomprehensible inconvenience (competing)' from users' point of view; further, adjusting of the problematic parts is extremely difficult, not to mention understanding the cause of the problem.
sen.cmt: 一原文一例文例外対処
sen.e: However, this is an 'incomprehensible inconvenience (competing)' from users' point of view and the adjustment of the problematic parts is extremely difficult, not to mention understanding the cause of the problem.

However, this is an 'incomprehensible inconvenience (competing)' from users' point of view and the adjustment of the problematic parts is extremely difficult, not to mention understanding the cause of the problem.

sen.j: 「むしろ買い換えるべきだ」とすら言われている背景には、「原因が無限に考えられ得るため、特定する手間を考えれば、購入資金分を諦めて別の同等品を新しく買った方が安上がり」という考えがある。
sen.e: The background of the case when a user is told to 'just buy a new one' is the idea that 'because the causes of the problem can be infinite, it is actually cheaper to buy a new one rather than spending time to specify the problem, even though the cost of the computer itself is wasted.'

The background of the case when a user is told to 'just buy a new one' is the idea that 'because the causes of the problem can be infinite, it is actually cheaper to buy a new one rather than spending time to specify the problem, even though the cost of the computer itself is wasted.'

The background of the case when a user is told to 'just buy a new one' is the idea that 'because the causes of the problem can be infinite, it is actually cheaper to buy a new one rather than spending time to specify the problem, even though the cost of the computer itself is wasted.'

sen.j: しかし中には不良品である可能性も含まれるため、購入店で個別に動作するかを確かめてもらう方が良い。
sen.e: It is better, however, to check if the individual parts operate at a shop where the given computer is bought as there is a possibility that it is a defective product.
It is better, however, to check if the individual parts operate normally at a shop where the computer was purchased as there is a possibility that it is a defective product.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。説明を補いました。
sen.e: It is better, however, to check if the individual parts operate normally at a shop where the computer was purchased as there is a possibility that it is a defective product.

sen.j: 逆に悪質な販売店では、初期不良品を「相性の問題だ」で済ます場合もある。
sen.e: On the other hand, vicious dealers might falsely blame the problem as 'the problem of compatibility' even if it was a defective product in the first place.
sen.cmt: 一原文一例文例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, vicious dealers might falsely blame the problem as 'the problem of compatibility' even if it was a defective product in the first place.
On the other hand, vicious dealers might falsely blame the problem as 'the problem of compatibility' even if it was a defective product in the first place.

sen.j: 関係者にとっては/dev/null以上に「何でも飲み込む穴」と云う事もできる。
sen.e: For the people involved, this can said to be a 'hole that swallows anything,' even when it is compared to/dev/null.
sen.cmt: 一原文一例文例外対処
sen.e: For the people involved, this can said to be a 'black hole' even when it is compared to/dev/null.
sen.cmt: /dev/null'はプログラマの間で'black hole'とも呼ばれているようですので、「何でも飲み込む穴」もこれを指していると思います。
sen.e: For the people involved, this can said to be a 'black hole' even when it is compared to/dev/null.
